results.title: The importance of presynaptic beta receptors in Raynaud's disease.
results.text_hl: Forty @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's disease@@@ were randomized into a trial in which @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (50 mg daily) was given with @CHEMICAL_Flunarizine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005444 @@@flunarizine@@@ (10 mg daily).

citations.NLM: Brotzu G, Falchi S, Mannu B, Montisci R, Petruzzo P, Staico R. The importance of presynaptic beta receptors in Raynaud's disease. J Vasc Surg. 1989 Jun;9(6):767-71. PMID: 2542629
citations.BibTeX: @article{2542629, title={The importance of presynaptic beta receptors in Raynaud's disease.}, author={Brotzu G and Falchi S and Mannu B and Montisci R and Petruzzo P and Staico R}, journal={J Vasc Surg}, volume={9}, number={6}, pages={767-71}}

results.title: Beta-blockers: a new therapeutic approach to Raynaud's disease.
results.text_hl: Thirty-six @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@RD@@@) were treated with a low dosage of beta-blockers, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (50 mg/day) or @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (20 mg/day).

citations.NLM: Brotzu G, Susanna F, Roberto M, Palmina P. Beta-blockers: a new therapeutic approach to Raynaud's disease. Microvasc Res. 1987 Mar;33(2):283-8. PMID: 2884554
citations.BibTeX: @article{2884554, title={Beta-blockers: a new therapeutic approach to Raynaud's disease.}, author={Brotzu G and Susanna F and Roberto M and Palmina P}, journal={Microvasc Res}, volume={33}, number={2}, pages={283-8}}

results.title: Comparison of quinapril and atenolol as single drugs or in combination with hydrochlorothiazide in moderate to severe hypertensives, using automated ambulatory monitoring.
results.text_hl: Adverse reactions were mild with both drugs except for severe @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud phenomenon@@@ in one @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Lacourcière Y, Lefebvre J, Provencher P, Poirier L. Comparison of quinapril and atenolol as single drugs or in combination with hydrochlorothiazide in moderate to severe hypertensives, using automated ambulatory monitoring. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1993 Feb;35(2):121-7. PMID: 8443029
citations.BibTeX: @article{8443029, title={Comparison of quinapril and atenolol as single drugs or in combination with hydrochlorothiazide in moderate to severe hypertensives, using automated ambulatory monitoring.}, author={Lacourcière Y and Lefebvre J and Provencher P and Poirier L}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={35}, number={2}, pages={121-7}}

results.title: Effect of beta-adrenoceptor antagonists on prevalence of peripheral vascular symptoms in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@Propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Oxprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010096 @@@oxprenolol@@@ and possibly @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were likely to produce such side effects.

citations.NLM: Steiner JA, Cooper R, McPherson K, Riley AJ. Effect of beta-adrenoceptor antagonists on prevalence of peripheral vascular symptoms in hypertensive patients. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1982 Dec;14(6):833-7. PMID: 6129884
citations.BibTeX: @article{6129884, title={Effect of beta-adrenoceptor antagonists on prevalence of peripheral vascular symptoms in hypertensive patients.}, author={Steiner JA and Cooper R and McPherson K and Riley AJ}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={14}, number={6}, pages={833-7}}
